VIII.iv.4.A.8.i
.
Entitlement to A&A Under the Provisions of PL 96-128
PL 96-128
amended
38 U.S.C. 1114(r)
concerning the awarding of A&A in cases where the SMC level is “n½ +k,” so that the SC disabilities used to establish entitlement to SMC at this level may also be used to establish entitlement to A&A if factual need is shown.
Under
PL 96-128
, entitlement to SMC under
38 U.S.C. 1114(r)(1)
exists if the basic criteria contained in
38 CFR 3.352(a)
are met, and
38 U.S.C. 1114(r)(2)
exists if the basic criteria contained in
38 CFR 3.352(b)
are met.
Note
:  Prior to enactment of
PL 96-12
, a Veteran had to be entitled to SMC under
38 U.S.C. 1114(o)
in order to establish entitlement to SMC under
38 U.S.C. 1114(r)(1)
and
38 U.S.C. 1114(r)(2)
.
